Token.title: Token
Token.description: Represents a token in the trading table.

symbol.description: Symbol of the token (e.g., BTC, ETH).

dailyChange.description: The amount the token price has changed in the last 24 hours.

dailyVolume.description: The amount of the token that has been traded in the last 24 hours.

isNewPair.description: Indicates if the token is a new pair.

isFinalStretch.description: Indicates if the token is in its final stretch.

isMigrated.description: Indicates if the token has been migrated.

definition.description: Stores token data. Each document represents a token in the trading table.

firestore.reasoning:
Given the application requirements for a token trading table, which involves fetching, displaying, and updating token data, including real-time price updates, the following Firestore structure is recommended:

Tokens are stored in a single collection called `tokens`. This simplifies querying and displaying the data in a table format.

Since the application uses mock data and doesn't involve user-specific data or collaborative features requiring authentication or authorization rules, a single top-level collection is sufficient.

This structure prioritizes simplicity and efficiency for the given use case. Authorization Independence is not applicable here as there are no authorization requirements. Segregation is also not relevant because there is only one data type. QAPs are supported since all tokens are stored in a single collection, making listing operations straightforward.
